ACHIEVE.Defintion: to succeed in finishing something or reaching an aim, especially after a lot of work or effort

ALIGNED.Defintion: to put two or more things into a straight line

ALLOCATED.Defintion: to give something to someone as their share of a total amount, to use in a particular way

AT THE HANDS OF.Defintion: If you suffer at the hands of someone, they hurt you or treat you badly

BULLIED.Defintion: someone who hurts or frightens someone else, often over a period of time, and often forcing them to do something that they do not want to do

BUREAUCRACY.Defintion: a system for controlling or managing a country, company, or organisation that is operated by a large number of officials employed to follow rules carefully

BUREAUCRATIC.Defintion: relating to a system of controlling or managing a country, company, or organisation that is operated by a large number of officials

CERTIFICATION.Defintion: the process of earning an official document, or the act of providing an official document, as proof that something has happened or been done

COFFEE LABEL.Defintion: a brand or type of coffee

COMMON.Defintion: the same in a lot of places or for a lot of people

CONJURE UP.Defintion: to make a picture or idea appear in someone's mind

COOPERATIVE.Defintion: a company owned and managed by the people who work in it

COOPERATIVES.Defintion: a company owned and managed by the people who work in it

CRITICS.Defintion: someone who says that they do not approve of someone or something

ETHICAL.Defintion: a system of accepted beliefs that control behaviour, especially such a system based on morals

EXPLOITATION.Defintion: the use of something in order to get an advantage from it

FAIR SHARE.Defintion: a lot, or more than enough, of something bad

FEEL-GOOD.Defintion: causing happy and positive feelings about life

FLUCTUATIONS.Defintion: a change, or the process of changing, especially continuously between one level or thing and another

HOVERING.Defintion: to stay in one place in the air, usually by moving the wings quickly; to stay at or near a particular level

IN-HOUSE.Defintion: Something that is done in-house is done within an organisation or business by its employees rather than by other people

INCENTIVE.Defintion: something that encourages a person to do something

INCENTIVES.Defintion: something that encourages a person to do something

INEFFICIENCIES.Defintion: a lack of organisation or skill that wastes time, energy, money, etc., or methods or actions that waste time, etc. in this way

INEVITABILITY.Defintion: the fact of being certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented

INSTANCES.Defintion: a particular situation, event, or fact, especially an example of something that happens generally

LABEL.Defintion: a piece of paper or other material that gives you information about the object it is attached to

LACK.Defintion: the fact that something is not available or that there is not enough of it

LOGO.Defintion: a design or symbol used by a company to advertise its products

MIDDLEMAN.Defintion: a person who buys goods from the company that has produced them and makes a profit by selling them to a shop or a user

MONITOR.Defintion: to watch and check a situation carefully for a period of time in order to discover something about it

NEGOTIATING.Defintion: to have formal discussions with someone in order to reach an agreement with them

NUMB.Defintion: If a part of your body is numb, you are unable to feel it, usually for a short time; not able to feel any emotions or to think clearly, because you are so shocked or frightened, et

OVERHEADS.Defintion: the regular and necessary costs, such as rent and heating, that are involved in operating a business

OVERSIGHT.Defintion: responsibility for a job or activity and for making sure it is being done correctly

PRECARIOUS.Defintion: in a dangerous state because of not being safe or not being held in place firmly

PREMIUM.Defintion: an amount that is more than usual

RETAILERS.Defintion: a person, shop, or business that sells goods to the public

ROSY.Defintion: If a situation is described as rosy, it gives hope of success or happiness

SALARIES.Defintion: a fixed amount of money agreed every year as pay for an employee, usually paid directly into his or her bank account every month

SCANDALS.Defintion: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

SCEPTICAL.Defintion: doubting that something is true or useful

SO-CALLED.Defintion: used to show that you think a word that is used to describe someone or something is not suitable or not correct

STABLE.Defintion: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change

STAMP.Defintion: a tool for putting a mark on an object either by printing on it or pushing into it, or the mark made in this way

SUPPLY CHAIN.Defintion: the system of people and things that are involved in getting a product from the place where it is made to the person who buys it

SUPPOSEDLY.Defintion: used to show that you do not believe that something you have been told is true

TENDED.Defintion: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

TERM.Defintion: a word or expression used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

TERMS.Defintion: words or expressions used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

TERMS OF TRADE.Defintion: the agreements of trade between two parties

VOLATILE.Defintion: likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly, especially by getting worse

WELL.Defintion: a deep hole in the ground from which you can get water, oil, or gas
